TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . He is a secondary school teacher .
He is represented before the ORG by Mr W. Heim , a lawyer practising in GPE .

On DATE ORG ( ORG ) convicted the applicant of disparaging the dignity of the deceased ( ORG ) pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW ) . It sentenced him to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , suspended on probation .

In its decision , ORG found that in DATE and DATE , the applicant had written letters to NORP politicians , in which he had complained about a planned amendment of CARDINAL of LAW on the punishment of incitement to hatred ( Anstachelung zum Rassenhass ) , expressly penalising the denial of national socialist mass killing . To those letters , the applicant had attached a statement in which he had denied the existence of gas chambers and the mass killing therein and had thereby denied the GPE particular cruel fate . The court observed that , according to the case - law of ORG ( Bundesverfassungsgericht ) and ORG ( ORG ) , the mass killing of NORP and other persons in gas chambers and inter alia in the FAC concentration camp was a historical fact ( historische ORG ) . The court further considered that , by denying this specific form of homicide , he had disparaged the dignity of the deceased . In this respect , it noted that the applicant had called the envisaged reform “ antidemocratic special legislation ” ( antidemokratisches PERSON ) , and had stated that political parties in ORG were “ no longer abiding by the rule of law and encouraging an antidemocratic demon ” ( so PERSON QUANTITY antidemokratischen Ungeist PERSON haben ) . He had further referred to “ historical lies ” ( PERSON ) and had qualified the gas chambers as “ so - called gas chambers ” .
The court further noted that an application for prosecution had been lodged in time .

In fixing the sentence , ORG noted that the applicant had previously been convicted of disparaging the dignity of the deceased , however , that conviction had not yet become final at the time of the material offence .
In these and the following proceedings , the applicant was assisted by defence counsel .

On DATE the NORP - Fürth Regional Court ( ORG ) dismissed the appeals lodged by the applicant and by ORG . As regards the applicant ’s argument that he had not intended to deny the existence of gas chambers , ORG considered that the contents of the letters objectively amounted to such a denial . In particular , he had used the term " historical lies " concerning the gassing in concentration camps , which was a historical fact and commonly known ( offenkundig ) . No taking of evidence had therefore been necessary . Moreover , having regard to the documents before it , ORG confirmed that the application for prosecution had been lodged in time .

On DATE ORG ( ORG ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law . ORG confirmed the findings of the lower courts , in particular that , as the mass killing in the concentration camps was a notorious historical fact , no taking of evidence concerning this point was necessary . Moreover , the procedural questions relating to the application for prosecution had been correctly determined .
On DATE ORG decided not to admit the applicant ’s constitutional complaint .
Section CARDINAL of the Penal Code provides as follows :
“ Anybody disparaging the memory of the deceased shall be punishable with imprisonment not exceeding DATE or with a fine . ”
Pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW , such an offence is prosecuted upon application by a relative of the victim of the offence .

Section CARDINAL of the LAW concerns the criminal offence of incitement to hatred . According to section CARDINAL ) , in the version as amended on DATE and entered into force on DATE , anybody who incites to hatred , or violence or arbitrary acts , against parts of the population in such a manner as to disturb the public peace shall be punishable by imprisonment for a term of DATE . Section PERSON ) relates to publications inciting to hatred . Section PERSON ) makes it a punishable act to approve , deny or minimise acts of genocide under the national socialist regime in public or at an assembly .
